column4: Hey guys. My wireless stopped working on my Ubuntu 8.10 installation, and when I tried the Fedora 9 Live CD (which previously had support for my wireless card) it also did not work. The wireless card is still visible when I run lspci.
Does this mean it is a hardware problem?
is it inside lspci?
Yup.
ooops. ok then what is it?
It fails to detect any networks at all.
i mean, what is the line of the card in lspci?
Realtek 8185. It worked out of the box on Ubuntu 8.10 beta and then stopped working. I tried Ndiswrapper but that also failed to work.
give me some time to think. i guess its some module again
in 8.04 were you using ndiswrapper to make it work?
Yes, I was. But that was unnecessary in 8.10 beta.
please give me a sec
No problem.
are you still there? they decided to make a kernel module finally!
And that means it should be supported?
try      sudo modprobe rtl8185
yes, natively supported by the kernel
do you get any error?
i am sure you will get because of the wrong name of the module
are you there?
Just turned on the laptop... and the wireless is working. Without me actually doing anything at all!
can you please tell me the module it uses?
How do I find out what module it uses?
lsmod | grep rtl                                    pm me the output because its loads of lins
